original_title: Sri Lanka rupee offered at 339 to dollar at close
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka rupee was offered 339 to the US dollar at close Wednesday in the spot market with no bids after opening at wide at 336/344 to the US dollar, dealer said.
There was some moral suasion used to small names which were trying to buy dollars, dealers said.
Sri Lanka’s monetary policy is generally supportive of a strong rupee, but exchange rate policy turned ad hoc in the first week of March with the central bank heavily on the buying side.

Banks which oversold can face losses by trying to balance their positions at current levels, analysts say. There is also Sri Lanka Development Bond maturity today, which will push bank open positions into negative if repaid in rupees.

Based on the earlier two months there was an excess of over 200 million dollars in inflows over outflows due to a contraction in private credit, allowing the country to run a balance of payments surplus.
In bond markets, yields fell, with sharp fall in Treasury bill auction prices.
A 01.07.2025 bond closed at 31.25/75 percent Wednesday, down from 31.75/32.25 percent a day earlier.
A 15.09.2027 bond closed at 28.00/25 percent down from 28.25/28.75 percent a day earlier.
